article.title: Accurate prediction of multicaloric response and thermodynamics in FeRh

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the primary focus of the article?
choices: The history of FeRh and its applications.
An assessment of computational methods for predicting caloric properties in materials, particularly those with anharmonic vibrations.
The synthesis and characterization of FeRh alloys.
The development of machine learning algorithms for caloric material discovery.

multiple_choice_question.text: Why is FeRh considered a suitable test system for assessing computational methods for predicting caloric properties?
choices: It is inexpensive and readily available.
It exhibits a simple, well-understood phase transition.
It displays a complex metamagnetic transition and non-harmonic vibrations, posing challenges for computational predictions.
It is commonly used in current solid-state cooling devices.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the key finding related to lattice entropy calculations in FeRh?
choices: Lattice entropy contributions are negligible in FeRh.
Standard linear-response methods accurately predict lattice entropy changes.
Anharmonic vibrations significantly affect lattice entropy and require specialized methods for accurate calculation.
Lattice entropy change is the dominant contributor to the total entropy change in FeRh.

multiple_choice_question.text: What is the potential benefit of accurate and reliable computational methods for predicting caloric properties?
choices: Reduce the need for expensive and time-consuming experiments.
Accelerate the discovery and design of new caloric materials with improved performance.
Enable the development of more efficient solid-state cooling devices.
